cte_events.description: Immerse yourself in the GMA Series at Texas A&M University, a curated selection of enriching academic events. From assessing understanding to supporting well-being, these experiences are tailored to enhance your professional development. Join us to broaden your knowledge, improve your skills, and engage with our vibrant intellectual community. Sign up today to start your remarkable learning journey!
A series of events focused on Additional Events.

events.event_name: Empower And Engage: High-Impact Teaching For Student Success
events.event_facilitators: Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Enhance your teaching to support student success through high-impact practices like community-engaged learning and collaborative projects. Learn actionable strategies to improve course design, increase student engagement, and promote academic excellence. This workshop provides practical tools to create meaningful learning experiences and unlock student potential.

events.event_name: Connecting Classrooms And Communities: An Introduction To Community-Engaged Learning
events.event_facilitators: Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Discover how community-engaged learning can enhance student success and community impact. Gain practical strategies for integrating civic engagement, community involvement, academic performance, and professional skills into course design. Whether new to these concepts or seeking to innovate teaching methods, this session offers valuable insights and tools for enriching the undergraduate educational experience.

events.event_facilitators:
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Discover the capabilities of Gemini, Google's advanced AI, and how it can enhance content creation, assessment design, and interactive learning experiences. Participants will explore key features, experiment with prompts, and brainstorm potential applications in their teaching contexts.

cte_events.description: Join us for our Course Design Series at Texas A&M University, where we dive into the essential elements of effective course design. From designing assessments to creating engaging learning experiences, attendees will gain valuable insights and strategies to enhance student learning outcomes. Don't miss out on this opportunity to elevate your teaching practices and make a lasting impact in the classroom!

events.event_name: Course Design Series: Session 1 - Crafting Learning Outcomes, The Foundation Of A Course
events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Learn how to design well-aligned courses by focusing on learning outcomes. Explore tools for creating and revising outcomes, consider course context, and practice writing student-centered, measurable outcomes. Discover ways to share outcomes with students and begin creating a course alignment map.

events.event_name: Course Design Series: Session 2 - Designing Assessments
events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Learn how assessments can enhance skill development and drive deep learning. Discover the importance of balancing formative and summative assessments to provide timely feedback. Explore tools in Canvas for assessing students and update your course alignment map.

cte_events.description: Join us at the Digital Learning Expo, where you'll discover innovative approaches to enhance teaching and learning through technology. Whether attending in-person or virtually, you'll gain valuable insights, tools, and strategies to elevate your digital learning experience. Don't miss this opportunity to connect with experts and colleagues in the field and take your teaching to the next level!

events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Join the Digital Learning Expo to explore innovative trends and strategies in digital education. Workshops will cover topics like Digital Accessibility, Generative AI, and Canvas tools. Walk away with practical strategies for all courses and collaborate with peers to integrate new approaches.

events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Join the Digital Learning Expo for engaging workshops on digital learning trends. Learn practical strategies for all courses and collaborate with peers. Gain insights on accessibility, generative AI, third-party tools, new analytics, and Canvas topics.

elp_events.description: Enhance your teaching skills and keep your students safe in the lab with our Academic Communication Skills Series. Learn key linguistic and pedagogical techniques to lead lab classes effectively and create a positive learning environment. Sign up now to improve your communication skills and excel in your role as a laboratory teaching assistant at Texas A&M University!

events.event_name: Academic Communication Skills: Leading A Lab Class (Part 1)
events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Enhance your teaching skills as a laboratory teaching assistant by developing proficiency in communicating safety protocols, monitoring student engagement, and addressing confusion. Gain strategies for responding to student questions and resources for enhancing listening comprehension in a workshop tailored for international instructors.

events.event_name: Academic Communication Skills: Leading A Lab Class (Part 2)
events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Enhance student learning and safety in the lab as a laboratory teaching assistant. Develop communication skills for safety protocols, student engagement, and addressing confusion. Gain strategies for responding to student questions and resources for improving listening comprehension. Ideal for international instructors.

weekly_events.description: Join us for an exciting weekly academic event series at Texas A&M University focused on honing English language proficiency through microteaching practice. Participants will have the opportunity to improve teaching and public speaking skills in a supportive and constructive environment. Don't miss out on this valuable opportunity to enhance your communication abilities and engage with a community of dedicated educators. Sign up now and take your professional development to the next level!
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: Join the Microteaching Practice (English Language Proficiency) sessions on Mondays at 8:30am-9:30am CDT and Wednesdays at 10:00am-11:00am CDT, facilitated by Ginessa Payne and Michele Vick from the Center for Teaching Excellence.

weekly_events.category_name: ELP Journal Club: A Conversation Circle For Text-Based Discussions
weekly_events.description: Join the ELP Journal Club at Texas A&M University for engaging text-based discussions that enhance your communication skills and critical thinking abilities. This series provides a supportive environment for faculty and staff to practice reading aloud, leading discussions, and collaborating on scholarly articles. Expand your knowledge, build confidence, and connect with a community of like-minded professionals. Elevate your academic experience and sign up for this enriching weekly event today!
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: Join the ELP Journal Club for text-based discussions every Monday at 11:00am - 12:00pm CDT with facilitator Michele Vick from the Center for Teaching Excellence.

weekly_events.category_name: Conversation Circle For English Language Proficiency
weekly_events.description: Join us at Texas A&M University's Conversation Circle for an enriching experience in improving English language proficiency. Engage in lively discussions on cultural topics to enhance your speaking skills, active listening, and conversational fluency. This weekly series offers a supportive environment for faculty and staff to hone their communication abilities and connect with a diverse community. Elevate your language skills and cultural awareness with us at Conversation Circle!
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: Join the Conversation Circle for English Language Proficiency sessions: Tuesdays 8:00am (Virtual), Wednesdays 1:00pm in BLOCKER 236 A, and Thursdays 9:00am (Virtual). Facilitators: Michele Vick and Sarah Vargas from the Center for Teaching Excellence.
